ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SPOORTHY Organization for Education and Social Development is one of the registered voluntary organizations based in Davangere of Karnataka It aimed at strengthening the weaker section through education and social development since its inception in the year 2000 for the creation of just equitable humane and sustainable society SPOORTHY working with marginalized and vulnerable namely poor of the poorest landless small and marginal farmers minorities backward classes Dalit and reserved communities for socio economic change Over the last 16 years SPOORTHY have been striving to ensure quality changes in the area of right to education right to food and work poverty alleviation through sustainable livelihood and income generation activities community involvement in protection of natural resources promotion of women and child rights empowerment of Women through Livelihood Opportunities Rehabilitation of flood victims assessment of children learning promoting women participation in Grama Panchayat election Process Leadership Development among minority women The intervention significantly contributed to enhance socio economic status of poor women and marginalized section in Davangere Gadag Haveri Chitradurga and Bagalkot District in particular and rest of Karnataka in general

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Grant was released for organizing the 78th Sree Ramanavami National Music Festival from 8th April 2016 to 5th May 2016 at Bengaluru. The festival showcased over 300 international repute artistes and was witnessed by over 2.5 lakhs audience over a period of 31 days.

The Grant was released for organizing the 77th Sree Ramanavami National Music Festival from 28th March 2015 to 27th April 2015 at Bengaluru. The festival showcased over 300 international repute artistes and was witnessed by over 2.5 lakhs audience over a period of 31 days.

The Grant was released for organizing the 79th Sree Ramanavami National Music Festival from 5th April 2017 to 5th May 2017 at Bengaluru. The festival showcased over 315 international repute artistes and was witnessed by over 3 lakhs audience over a period of 31 days.

The Grant was released for organizing the 80th Sree Ramanavami National Music Festival from 25th March 2018 to 24th April 2018 at Bengaluru. The festival showcased over 350 international repute artistes and was witnessed by over 3 lakhs audience over a period of 31 days.
The Ministry of culture in its 39th meeting has released a sum of Rs.5 lakhs towards paying remuneration of artistes participating in the 80th Ramanavami Global Music Festival 2018

The Grant has been sanctioned to organizing the 81st Sree Ramanavami National Music Festival from 6th April 2019 to 6th May 2019 at Bengaluru. The festival showcased over 400 international repute artistes and was witnessed by over 5 lakhs audience over a period of 31 days.
Various PSUs, Companies, Organisations and donors contributed towards Mandalis 82nd Sree Ramanavami Global Music Festival that was organised virtually.

The Grant was released for organizing Bangalore s iconic 83rd Sree Ramanavami Global Music Festival at the Special Pandal, Old Fort HIgh School Grounds that was organised from 13th April 2021 to 13th May 2021 in a all new hybrid format.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Trust was started on 1st May, 2004 after successful of Practicing and Survey in the Nature Care Ayurvedic Medicine from same interest youths of different fields. Preparation of Herbal and Natural Medicines, Cosmetics and Health Food Products. Research in the field of ancient medicine theories and practices. Exploring the Formula on Micro-vita. Science on Health beneficial to the man kind. Workshop, Seminars and Training to lead healthy life and do self business on the relative fields.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The purpose of Herbal Nature Campaign is to identify relevant, integrated, natural activities and channels to reach the objectives of the Trust as well as influence different generations. This campaign had an engaging, shareable, effective concept which utilized both traditional and modern promotional communications tools to reach both rural and urban residents as well as younger and older generations.

The importance of herb, shrub and trees for curing and preventing ailments is an old age tradition, which has been relegated to the background due to invasion of modern system of drug. There is an awakening all over the globe to turn back to the traditional treatment using plants part as an affordable way and to revive traditional system of medicine uninterrupted supply of genuine raw material are of prime necessity.

The resource pool of the Ayurveda medicinal plants were abundant in forest but forest areas are dwindling fast due to urban pressure. Therefore the alternative means to generate more raw materials could be only through cultivation of medicinal plants in agriculture fields. The main objective of Ayurveda Flower Plantation is to promote cultivation of Ayurveda plants and its sustainable management across the country and to reduce pressure on the collection from wild habitat in forests.

General Donation from General Public, Trust Members, Trust Board of Directors, Local NGOs, Friends, Relatives and Well-wishers. Service Charges for rendering Health and Environment Services. Income from Sale of Medicinal Plants, Health Products and Food Products prepared from the Trust.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Sri Rajarajeshwari Kala Niketan (SRRKN), a reputable arts institution directed by Mrs. Veena Murthy Vijay, has been actively involved in contributing to the propagation of Indian classical art forms in Bangalore for the past 30 years. SRRKN is committed to enhancing the artistic knowledge of todays youth through practical and theoretical education. We work to provide a venue for todays youth to explore their cultural heritage through creative and artistic display. Furthermore, we expose the youth and the local community to an array of entertainment featuring Indias most esteemed &world-renowned artists. Our institution has educated over 300 students and has provided them with training in various art forms including classical dance, yoga and music. Since its inception in the year 1976, Sri Raja Rajeshwari Kala Niketan is working towards development of arts and culture in Karnataka. SRRKN has been conducting various Dance & Music festivals to propagate the traditional Arts forms, over thirty years celebrating Sri Rama Navami celebrations and Samanvay Arts Festival a festival of Dance and Music. Along with this, training the students in dance forms like Kuchipudi, Bharatanatyam, Classical Music, conducting seminars, Lecture Demonstrations & workshops in India & abroad.

ngoList.address: SRI RAMKRISHNA SEVASHRAMA SRI RAMAKRISHNA PARAMAHAMSA MARGA PAVAGADA 561202
ngoList.title: SRI RAMAKRISHNA SEVASHRAMA
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Achievements Pavagada Taluk remained a Leprosy-endemic area till the 1990, despite the Governments efforts. Due to the regions remoteness and inhospitable socio-political environment, the health department could not even post any dedicated workers. It was a bleak situation. In 1991 Swami Japanandaji who had founded Sri Ramakrishna Sevashrama Sister concerns Swami Vivekananda Integrated Rural Health Centre from scratch, took up the challenge and took over the project from government under NLEP. After the incessant struggle of a dedicated team for 25 years, Pavagada has now been declared as non-endemic for Leprosy. The feat has received wide acclaim. All through these years, Team Vivekananda lead by Swami Japanandaji has simultaneously battled another dreaded disease, Tuberculosis. So far 12000 cases of Tuberculosis have been handled comprehensively, providing drug treatment, food, as also rehabilitation free of cost to the needy poor, resulting in an exceptional success rate. Recognizing the institute most qualitative and documented work, Central Government enrolled SVIRHC as an RNTCP Unit  the only NGO-hosted unit in Karnataka. Now, the latest GeneXpert facility makes this an exclusive private organisation handling it in the entire country. Many research oriented projects have also been taken up by SVIRHC with NTI several research papers published in international journals. The malaise of HIV and AIDS in this backward region is being tackled systematically by a dedicated unit at SVIRHC, as a part of its humanitarian mission. Gradually extending the ophthalmic facilities, a state-of-the-art Eye hospital has been set up for the sake of the poorest sections of about 8 lakh population. It has to its credit, about 20000 successful eye surgeries of all categories, including cataract. Many ophthalmic research studies of relevance to the target population have been taken up; they have received wide attention, and been published in international journals. With his concerned love for children, Japanandaji has developed a paediatric eye care wing, which has served and saved hundreds of children, who could otherwise never afford or avail of such high cost facilities. One of the innovative initiatives of Swamiji towards the total elimination of TB and creation of a healthy community is the Food for Patients Project. Many of the TB patients, even after declared cured following a lengthy treatment regime, cannot afford a healthy diet due to their disabilities. To overcome this problem, hundreds of such patients are being provided free food grains. SVIRHC, located in a remote corner of the state, takes pride in being the only facility in Karnataka to be offering the highly specialized and vital Reconstructive Surgery (RCS) for Leprosy cured patients. It is no small achievement that so far 476 complex RCS have been done, that too free of charges (costs up to Rs.60,000), thanks to a very humane stand taken by Swamiji. Elaborate post-treatment care and livelihood support have enabled early 50 cured leprosy patients so far to own/take up petty shops, tailoring, house renovation, cattle rearing etc, and lead normal lives.

ngoList.ngoName: Sri Ramanjaneya Togalu Gombe Mela Trust
ngoList.address: Sri Ramanjaneya Togalu Gombe Mela Trust 1/19, Rangabhoomi, Kanaka Street, Near Radio Park, Ganesh temple Street, Cowl Bazar, Bellary - 583102
ngoList.title: Sri Ramanjaneya Togalu Gombe Mela Trust
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Sri Ramanjaneya togalu gombe mela, Trust, Bellary. Striving hard for upliftment of leather puppetry farm of folk art for the last thirty years. This ancient art was confined to the plays of mythology only, but the institution ventured to perform this art farm availing the historical and social themes like 1857 Indian independence movement, Mahatma gandhiji, Prophet, Basaveshwar, kitturu Rani Chennamma and so on. Amazingly the leather puppet shows are welcomed in rural and urban areas. When the social themes exhibited like National Rural Development health care, Nutritious food, Pulse Polio immunisation, AIDS awareness, Affect of Tobacco, Irradiation of Malaria, and such other programmes. This institution has given has given performances all round the country the prestigious festivals like, Apna-Utsav, New Delhi, Dakshinotsavam, Trivandrum, National Festival, Nagpur, fe-te-de- Pondicherry, Putul Yaatra, New Delhi, Inter culture exchange festivals, throughout the state of kerala and Bihaar, Bapu Shows at Rastrpathi Bhavan and various places of New Delhi. Recently our institution has been visited Zurich, Switzerland, participating as part of art exhibition which was related on Ramayan exhibition title Rama and SIta, there we gave more than fifteen shows Panchavati Prasanga i.e., seetas abduction. The exhibition organised by the Riet berg Museum Zurich, due to the event of 60th anniversary of Indo Swiss friendship, the festival name titled BHARATOTSAV. It is a new and enthralling experience of the troupe artists of the institute, not only gave the performances and also conducted a workshop on puppetry how to prepare the puppets with miniature work and painting and manipulating puppets and perform the puppet show. The institution has produced many shows in this folk art which are telecasted in Doordarshan New Delhi, and Bangalore. The tele serial based on mahatma gandhijis achievement of life titled BAAPU. Thus we have been working for this ancient folk art farm, and successfully carrying on the largest activities and giving programme. Not only supporting this ancient stage art farm, but also some families of puppeteers are depending this art farm by the institution efforts which a hope continues to make alive this rare kind of art farm.
